title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below use p_load of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in te environment, it will luanch it into R if it has been installed.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
pacman::p_load(ggplot2)
pacman::p_load(forcats)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv", 
                      show_col_types = FALSE)





hist(exam_data$MATHS,
     main = "Histogram of Maths Exams Result",
     xlab = "Score",
     xlim = c(0, 100),
     ylab = "Count",
     ylim = c(0, 80),
     col = "lightblue",
     freq = TRUE)








ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) + 
  
  geom_histogram(bins = 10, 
                 boundary = 100, 
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "lightblue") +
  
  labs(title = "Histogram of Exams Result", 
       subtitle = "Maths",
       x = "Score",
       y = "Count") +
  
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth = 2.5, dotsize = 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL) +
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "lightblue") +
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "grey30")+
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           colour = GENDER)) +
  geom_density() + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE) + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter", size = 0.5) + 
  theme_bw()









violin plot is a hybrid of a box plot and a kernel density plot shows peaks in the data. it can visualize the distribution of numerical data.
violin plot depict summary statistics and the density of each variable. (source: https://mode.com/blog/violin-plot-examples)



ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin() + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin(fill = "lightblue") +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5) + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun = "mean",
               colour = "red",
               size = 4) + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat = "summary",
             fun = "mean",
             colour = "red",
             size = 4) + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  # default method used for smooth is loess
  # geom_smooth(linewidth = 0.5)
  geom_smooth(linewidth = 0.5, method = lm) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), ylim = c(0, 100)) + 
  theme_bw()

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'









ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
    facet_wrap(~ CLASS) + 
  theme_bw()








ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
    facet_grid(cols = vars(CLASS)) + 
  theme_bw()

Working with facet

Working with facet: View Maths Exam Result by Gender and Class using facet_grid()

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(y = MATHS, x = CLASS)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
    facet_grid(cols = vars(GENDER)) + 
      theme_bw()






Working with facet: View Maths Exam Result by Gender and Class using facet_grid()

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(y = MATHS, x = CLASS)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
    facet_grid(rows = vars(GENDER)) +
      theme_bw()






Working with facet: View Maths Exam Result by Gender and Class using facet_grid()

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(y = MATHS, x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
    facet_grid(rows = vars(GENDER), cols = vars(CLASS)) +
      theme_bw()






View Race in Bar chart in vertical form

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
    theme_bw()






View Race in Bar chart in horizontal form

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() + 
  theme_bw()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis

Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - View Race in Bar chart in vertical form

pct_format = scales::percent_format(accuracy = .1)

exam_data %>%
  mutate(RACE = fct_infreq(RACE)) %>%
  ggplot((aes(x = RACE))) +
  geom_bar() +
  
  geom_text(aes(label = sprintf(
                            '%d (%s)', 
                            after_stat(count), 
                            pct_format(
                              after_stat(count) / sum(after_stat(count))
                              )
                            )
                ),
            stat="count",
            nudge_y = 8 ) +
  labs(title = "No. of Pupils by Race in Exam Results", 
       y="No. of Pupils") 






Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - View Race in Bar chart in vertical form

pct_format = scales::percent_format(accuracy = .1)

exam_data %>%
  mutate(RACE = fct_infreq(RACE)) %>%
  ggplot((aes(x = RACE))) +
  geom_bar(aes(fill = RACE), show.legend = TRUE) +
  
  geom_text(aes(label = sprintf(
                          '%d (%s)', 
                          after_stat(count), 
                          pct_format(
                            after_stat(count) / sum(after_stat(count))
                          )
                        )
                ),
            stat="count",
            nudge_y = 8 ) +
  labs(title = "No. of Pupils by Race in Exam Results", 
       y="No. of Pupils") 






Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - Adding mean and median lines on the histogram plot

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +

  geom_histogram(bins = 20, color = "black", fill="lightblue") +
  
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(exam_data$MATHS), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="red") + 
  
  geom_vline(xintercept = median(exam_data$MATHS), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="black") + 
  
  theme_bw()






Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - Adding background to facet_grid()

ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(data = exam_data["ENGLISH"], 
                 bins = 20, 
                 fill="lightgrey", 
                 alpha=0.5) +
  geom_histogram(aes(fill=GENDER), 
                 col="black", 
                 bins = 20) +
  facet_grid(cols = vars(GENDER)) + 
  theme_bw()






Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - fixed reference lines on scatterplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  
  geom_point() + 
  
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(50), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="grey") +
  
  geom_hline(yintercept = mean(50), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="grey") + 
  
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), 
                  ylim = c(0, 100)) + 
  theme_bw()






Designing Data-drive Graphics for Analysis - mean reference lines on scatterplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  
  geom_point() + 
  
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(exam_data$MATHS), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="grey") +
  
  geom_hline(yintercept = mean(exam_data$ENGLISH), 
             linetype="dashed", 
             linewidth=1, 
             colour="grey") +
  
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 100), 
                  ylim = c(0, 100)) + 
  
  theme_bw()
